captions.text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

And it’s the holiday season which is the
perfect time for some tasty treats,

I love this time of year and today I’m gonna
share some fun and easy recipe ideas.
Let’s get started!

The 1st treat that we’re gonna be making
are these cute Melted Snowman Cookies,

I found this recipe on the Country Crock website
and I really like this
recipe because they’re chewy and soft.

The things you will need to make these cookies
are: 1 cup of Country Crock,

1 cup of sugar, 1 egg, 2 teaspoons of vanilla
extract, 2 and 2/3 cup of flour,

1 and 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder, 1 teaspoon
of salt, and to decorate we’re

gonna need some peanut butter cups, we’re
gonna need regular and bite size,

orange sprinkles, vanilla cookie icing and
black cookie icing.

The 1st thing that we’re gonna do is in
our big mixing bowl, we are gonna cream

together our spread and sugar, we’re gonna
beat these together for about 3
minutes until the mixture is light and fluffy!

Next we’re gonna add in our egg and vanilla,
and then beat them together until
they’re well combined!

I’m using a spatula to scrape down the sides
of the bowl to make sure
everything is being mixed evenly.

Oh, and I found this cute little holiday spatula,
how adorbs!

Now we’re gonna add the flour, baking powder,
and salt.
Salty, salty, salty! Salty, salty, salty!

And we’re gonna mix together for the last
time until everything is well combined.

Once your dough is all mixed up, we’re gonna
take the tablespoon measurement and
scoop 2 tablespoons.

1, bloop, and 2, bloop! Of the dough and roll
them together to make our cookies.

I like to take a little bit of flour, sprinkle
it in your hand so that they don’t stick.

And once you’ve rolled your ball, place
it onto an un-greased cookie sheet about

3 inches apart, do that to the rest of your
cookies.

And now we’re gonna bake these in the oven
at 375 for 12 to 14 minutes
or until they start to turn light golden brown.

Once your cookies are done baking and they’ve
had plenty of time to cool,

we are gonna decorate them, starting with
our vanilla cookie icing.

I’ve put the icing into a plastic bag with
a number 2 tip at the end
for a little bit more control.

You are gonna trace a squiggly outline on
the top of your cookies, and then
you’re gonna fill it in!

Do this to all of your cookies and let them
set for about 10 minutes, and

while they are setting, we’re gonna make
some snowman hats out of peanut
butter cups!

1st, cut the bite size peanut butter cup in
half, then cut the larger, fun size

peanut butter cup in half and cut off
the bottom for the rim of the hat.

Now you’re gonna stack them together and
place them on top of your cookies.
Boop, boop!

To make the snowman’s face you’re gonna
grab your cookie icing again and trace
a circle underneath the peanut butter cup and fill it in.

While the icing is still wet, add a little
orange sprinkle on top of each
cookie for the nose!

Now for the final decoration step, we’re
gonna take our black icing with a
number 2 tip and add his little eyeballs!
Boop, boop, ba-doop!
They’re so cute!
Ta-da!

Here are our melted snowman cookies, snowmen
are one of my favorite things about

the holidays, so many great memories building
them with my family in the
yard growing up.

Also, I love this recipe, the cookies are
so chewy!
Om-yum-yum-yum-yum!

Now onto our next treat, we’re gonna be
making Mini Reindeer Donuts!

The things you will need, will be: Mini chocolate
donuts, mini pretzels,

a bowl of round red candies and a bowl of
white sugar pearl candies.

The 1st thing that we’re gonna do is make
antlers out of our little pretzels!

Take one of the pretzels over to the cutting
board, I’m using a serrated knife,
and gently cut the pretzel down the middle.
Ew-ew-ew-erew-erew-erew-erew!
OK! Just like that!

Now do this to the rest of your pretzels for
as many reindeer donuts as
you’d like to make.

You are gonna take your donut and take 2 pretzel
antlers and gently press
them into the top of the donut.

Then take a red candy and place it right in
the middle for his little nose!

Lastly you’re gonna take 2 small pearl candies
and press them to make
2 little reindeer eyeballs!
Ta-da!

Here are our Reindeer Donuts! I love this
treat because they are so easy to make!

They’re a great idea if you’re in a hurry
to a holiday party and you guys

know me, I like my chocolate covered pretzels,
so salty and sweet!

For the last recipe, we’re gonna be making
something very near to my heart.

Every Christmas morning my family makes pancakes,
so in honor of that tradition
we are gonna be making Snowman Pancakes!

The things you will need, will be: 1 cup of
flour, 3/4 cup of milk, 1 egg,

1 tablespoon of spread, 2 teaspoons of baking
powder, 1 tablespoon of sugar,

1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla extract, some bacon,
chocolate chips and some marshmallows.

1st thing that we’re gonna do is whisk together
all of our dry ingredients,

in a big mixing bowl you’re gonna add your
flour, baking powder and sugar.

And then whisk it up! Wh-whisk it up! Wh-whisk
it up! Whisk, whisk!

Next we’re gonna add in our wet ingredients,
melt your spread in the microwave

and pour it into our flour mixture, along
with 1 egg,
our vanilla extract, and milk!

Whisk this all together until the batter is
combined, and once it’s all mixed

we’re gonna take it over to the stove and
make some pancakes!

Grease your pan and then set your stovetop
heat to medium-low.

To make these snowman pancakes I’m using
a 1/2 tablespoon. I use 1 scoop
for the head and 3 scoops for the body.

You want a little circle on the top and a
big circle on the bottom.

You can also push the batter around just a
little bit in the pan to make your shapes.

When you see the little bubbles start to form
around the edges of the pancake,
you’ll know it’s time to flip ‘em over!

Once your pancakes are done, we are gonna
cook up some bacon to make the
snowman’s little scarf.

Turn your heat up to medium-high and put a
few strips down in your pan.
Once your bacon is done cooking, take the strips off and put them on a plate

with some paper towels to catch the grease
that might drip off.

Now it’s time for my favorite part, we’re
gonna decorate!

You’re gonna take 3 chocolate chips, put
2 for his eyes, 1 for his nose and then
3 down the middle for buttons!

Then to keep your little snowman warm, we’re
gonna give him a bacon scarf!
Tear the bacon in half, and assemble.
So fashionable! So much fashion!

Now you’re gonna take your little marshmallows,
yum, yum, yum!

And place them at the bottom to look like
snow!
Let it snow! Let it snow! Let it snow!
Now you can decorate the rest of your snowmen!
Ta-da!
Here are all the holiday treats that we made.

We made our Melted Snowmen Sugar Cookies,
Om-nom-nom-nom-nom!

Mini Reindeer Donuts, I love the little pretzel
antlers, so cute!

And Snowman Pancakes with their yummy Bacon
Scarves!

I hope you guys enjoyed this video and you
have some happy holidays,

Thank you for watching, and a thank you to
Country Crock for partnering with
me to make this video.
Alright, bye-bye you guys!
And… Maybe I’ll just have 1 more cookie!
Hmmm, hmmm, hmmm, hmmm, hmmm!

comments.text:
as soon as i saw the first recipe i went to make sure we had the 
ingredients, then i started making the cookies. if anybody is wondering, 
the baking powder is not absolutely necessary. We didnt have any so I just 
went on a limb and followed the recipe, but without the baking powder. also 
a beater is not necessary. i tried my best to whisk the spread and eggs 
together the best i could. I just gave up when it was all lumpy and added 
in the sugar. it all came together in a fluffy mix after i whisked in the 
sugar. sadly i left the cookies in the oven to long and burnt the bottom of 
the cookies. but the top half of the cookies were tremendous!!!! i didnt do 
the decoration though; i just wanted some plain cookies. but ro, this is a 
great recipe and so yummy. thanks for posting!!!! oxo
 ﻿
